[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Encoding failure propagation] If bcs::to_bytes() fails due to an unsupported StateValue variant or internal error, does the error properly propagate up the call stack to prevent partial database writes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Deterministic encoding] Does BCS guarantee that encode_value() produces byte-for-byte identical output across all validators for the same StateValue, or can floating-point or timing dependencies cause non-determinism? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Memory allocation] Can repeated calls to encode_value() for large StateValue objects cause memory fragmentation or allocation failures that degrade validator performance over time? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [PersistedStateValueMetadata version] Does encode_value() correctly handle StateValueMetadata with both V0 and V1 PersistedStateValueMetadata variants, or can version mismatches cause serialization errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Option<StateValue> edge case] Can encode_value() handle the case where StateValue.data is empty (zero bytes) but metadata exists, ensuring this is properly distinguished from None? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Deserialization exploit] Can an attacker inject maliciously crafted BCS bytes into the database (through consensus bypass or storage corruption) that cause bcs::from_bytes() to deserialize into an invalid StateValue with corrupted metadata? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Type confusion] Can decode_value() be tricked into deserializing Some(StateValue) as None or vice versa through BCS encoding ambiguities, causing state values to appear deleted or deleted values to appear present? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Buffer underflow] If the data slice passed to decode_value() is shorter than expected for a valid BCS-encoded Option<StateValue>, can bcs::from_bytes() read beyond buffer bounds or produce undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Malformed BCS] Can database corruption result in BCS bytes that cause bcs::from_bytes() to panic rather than return an error, crashing validators during state retrieval? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [StateValueMetadata corruption] If PersistedStateValueMetadata is deserialized with negative deposit values or future timestamps (through bit flips), does decode_value() validate these, or can corrupted metadata propagate through the system? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Version mismatch handling] Can decode_value() deserialize StateValue objects that were encoded with a future BCS schema version, potentially causing forward compatibility issues during protocol upgrades? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Incomplete deserialization] If bcs::from_bytes() successfully deserializes the first part of data but trailing garbage bytes remain, is this detected as an error, or can truncated state values be returned? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Integer overflow in metadata] When deserializing StateValueMetadata with deposit fields, can u64 overflow occur if the serialized values are near u64::MAX, causing incorrect deposit calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Memory exhaustion during decode] Can decode_value() encounter BCS-encoded StateValue with claimed size > available memory, causing out-of-memory errors that crash validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Rapid hash cache corruption] If StateValue.maybe_rapid_hash is deserialized with incorrect (hash, size) values, can this cause cache poisoning that breaks Merkle tree integrity? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Type: Key] [Hash collision vulnerability] If an attacker finds a collision in HashValue (SHA3-256), can they create two different StateKeys that map to the same (HashValue, Version) key, allowing them to overwrite or steal state values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Type: Key] [Version uniqueness] Does the schema guarantee that only one StateValue exists per (HashValue, Version) tuple, or can duplicate entries be inserted through race conditions during parallel writes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Schema: StateValueByKeyHashSchema] [Column family isolation] Is STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME properly isolated from other column families, or can cross-CF key collisions occur in RocksDB that corrupt state values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Schema: StateValueByKeyHashSchema] [Atomic writes] When a batch write updates multiple (HashValue, Version) entries, is the entire batch committed atomically, or can partial writes cause inconsistent state if a validator crashes mid-commit? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Schema: StateValueByKeyHashSchema] [Index ordering] Does the reverse version ordering (via bitwise-NOT) guarantee that iteration always returns newest versions first, or can sorting edge cases cause old versions to appear before new ones? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Type: Option<StateValue>] [Deletion semantics] Is None used to represent deleted state values, and if so, can an attacker exploit the difference between None and Some(StateValue::empty()) to revive deleted accounts or resources? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Schema: StateValueByKeyHashSchema] [Pruning safety] When old versions are pruned from the database, does the schema guarantee that the latest version is always preserved, or can pruning accidentally delete the current state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Type: Key] [Version monotonicity] Does the schema enforce that version numbers always increase, or can a malicious validator insert state values with decreasing versions that violate causal ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Schema: StateValueByKeyHashSchema] [Sharding consistency] When enable_sharding is true, does the schema ensure that all shards have consistent versions of state values, or can shard-specific corruption cause validators to diverge? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/state_value_by_key_hash/mod.rs] [Schema: StateValueByKeyHashSchema] [Snapshot isolation] Can concurrent reads and writes to the same (HashValue, Version) key violate snapshot isolation, causing readers to see partially updated state values? (High)
